member.name: T:FastCGI.Constants
member.summary: FastCGI constants. Defined in the FastCGI specification section 8.

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_LISTENSOCK_FILENO
member.summary: Listening socket file number

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_HEADER_LEN
member.summary: Number of bytes in a FCGI_Header. Future versions of the protocol will not reduce this number.

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_VERSION_1
member.summary: Value for version component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_BEGIN_REQUEST
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_ABORT_REQUEST
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_END_REQUEST
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_PARAMS
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_STDIN
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_STDOUT
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_STDERR
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_DATA
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_GET_VALUES
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_GET_VALUES_RESULT
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_UNKNOWN_TYPE
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_MAXTYPE
member.summary: Values for type component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_NULL_REQUEST_ID
member.summary: Value for requestId component of FCGI_Header

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_KEEP_CONN
member.summary: Mask for flags component of FCGI_BeginRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_RESPONDER
member.summary: Values for role component of FCGI_BeginRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_AUTHORIZER
member.summary: Values for role component of FCGI_BeginRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_FILTER
member.summary: Values for role component of FCGI_BeginRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_REQUEST_COMPLETE
member.summary: Values for protocolStatus component of FCGI_EndRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_CANT_MPX_CONN
member.summary: Values for protocolStatus component of FCGI_EndRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_OVERLOADED
member.summary: Values for protocolStatus component of FCGI_EndRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_UNKNOWN_ROLE
member.summary: Values for protocolStatus component of FCGI_EndRequestBody

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_MAX_CONNS
member.summary: Variable names for FCGI_GET_VALUES / FCGI_GET_VALUES_RESULT records

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_MAX_REQS
member.summary: Variable names for FCGI_GET_VALUES / FCGI_GET_VALUES_RESULT records

member.name: F:FastCGI.Constants.FCGI_MPXS_CONNS
member.summary: Variable names for FCGI_GET_VALUES / FCGI_GET_VALUES_RESULT records

member.name: F:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.OpenRequests
member.summary: A dictionary of all open requests, indexed by id.

member.name: F:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.CurrentStream
member.summary: The network stream of the connection to the webserver.
member.remarks: Can be null if the application is currently not connected to a webserver.

member.name: P:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.Connected
member.summary: True iff this application is currently connected to a webserver.

member.name: F:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.Disconnecting
member.summary: True iff this application is about to close the connection to the webserver.

member.name: E:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.OnRequestReceived
member.summary: Will be called whenever a request has been received.
member.remarks: Please note that multiple requests can be open at the same time. This means that this event may fire multiple times before you call on the first one.

member.name: M:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.Run(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method never returns! Starts listening for FastCGI requests on the given port.

member.name: M:FastCGI.FCGIApplication.SendRecord(FastCGI.Record)
member.summary: Used internally. Sends the given record to the webserver.

member.name: T:FastCGI.Record
member.summary: A FastCGI Record.
member.remarks: See section 3.3 of the FastCGI Specification for details.

member.name: T:FastCGI.Record.RecordType
member.summary: Record types, used in the 'type' field of Record.
member.remarks: Described in the FastCGI Specification section 8.

member.name: T:FastCGI.Record.ProtocolStatus
member.summary: Protocol status used for requests. Described in the FastCGI Specification section 8.

member.name: F:FastCGI.Record.Version
member.summary: The version byte. Should always equal .

member.name: F:FastCGI.Record.Type
member.summary: The of this record.

member.name: F:FastCGI.Record.RequestId
member.summary: The request id associated with this record.

member.name: F:FastCGI.Record.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of .

member.name: F:FastCGI.Record.ContentData
member.summary: The data contained in this record.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.GetNameValuePairs
member.summary: Tries to read a dictionary of name-value pairs from the record content.
member.remarks: This method does not make any attempt to make sure whether this record actually contains a set of name-value pairs. It will return nonsense or throw an EndOfStreamException if the record content does not contain valid name-value pairs.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.SetNameValuePairs(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Sets the record to a given dictionary of name-value pairs.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.ReadVarLength(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a length from the given stream, which is encoded in one or four bytes.
member.remarks: See section 3.4 of the FastCGI specification for details.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.ReadByte(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a single byte from the given stream.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.ReadInt16(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a 16-bit integer from the given stream.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.WriteInt16(System.IO.Stream,System.Int16)
member.summary: Writes a 16-bit integer to the given stream.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.WriteVarLength(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a length from the given stream, which is encoded in one or four bytes.
member.remarks: See section 3.4 of the FastCGI specification for details.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.ReadRecord(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a single Record from the given stream.
member.returns: Returns the retreived record or null if no record could be read.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.WriteToStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes this record to the given stream.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes written.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.CreateStdout(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a Stdout record from the given data and request id

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.CreateEndRequest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a EndRequest record with the given request id

member.name: M:FastCGI.Record.CreateGetValuesResult(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a GetValuesResult record from the given config values.

member.name: T:FastCGI.Request
member.summary: A FastCGI request.
member.remarks: A request usually corresponds to a HTTP request that has been received by the webserver. You will probably want to use or its helper methods to output a response and then call . Use to be notified of new requests. Refer to the FastCGI specification for more details.

member.name: P:FastCGI.Request.RequestId
member.summary: The id for this request, issued by the webserver

member.name: F:FastCGI.Request.Parameters
member.summary: The FastCGI parameters passed by the webserver.
member.remarks: All strings are encoded in ASCII, regardless of any encoding information in the request.

member.name: P:FastCGI.Request.Body
member.summary: The request body.
member.remarks: For POST requests, this will contain the POST variables. For GET requests, this will be empty.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Request.HandleRecord(FastCGI.Record)
member.summary: Used internally. Feeds a Record to this request for processing.
member.returns: Returns true iff the request is completely received.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Request.WriteResponse(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Appends data to the response body.
member.remarks: The given data will be sent immediately to the webserver as a single stdout record.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Request.WriteResponseASCII(System.String)
member.summary: Appends an ASCII string to the response body.
member.remarks: This is a helper function, it converts the given string to ASCII bytes and feeds it to .
member.param: The string to append, encoded in ASCII.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Request.WriteResponseUtf8(System.String)
member.summary: Appends an UTF-8 string to the response body.
member.remarks: This is a helper function, it converts the given string to UTF-8 bytes and feeds it to .
member.param: The string to append, encoded in UTF-8.

member.name: M:FastCGI.Request.Close
member.summary: Closes this request.
